overview:
Steven Bristol is a programmer that’s been cranking out quality code since he was nine. With the experience to write everything proxy servers (C++ on Linux) to global human resources applications (C# on Windows), Steve found the love of his life with Ruby on Rails. In 2007 he co-founded Less Everything with designer, Allan Branch, and the company has since produced fast and reliable web apps to help make life simpler for others.

Steven is also a core contributor to the Rails Framework and has contributed to several other open source projects. He created the open source social network Lovd By Less, was a mentor in the 2007 Google Summer of Code and is a frequent co-host of the popular podcast, The Web 2.0 Show.

Steve’s projects include: LessAccounting.com, LovdByLess.com, LessMemories.com, GetMoreHoney, LessFriends.
